intro: Ruellia hoffmannseggii, commonly known as the Hoffmannsegg's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, blue to violet flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Ruellia hoffmannseggii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
